result.execSummary:
The defendant Stacey M Hutterer was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Manufacture/Deliver Heroin (<3g), a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(1)(d)1.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant IS eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant IS eligible for Substance Abuse Program.
Apply 258 days sentence credit.

superMiscConds.notes:
Buy Money ($400) to be paid to the Waukesha County Metro Drug Unit and to be paid BEFORE costs/fines/surcharges.  Court costs ($268) and DNA surcharge ($250) are assessed.  Buy Money, court costs and DNA surcharge are to be paid as a Condition of Extended Supervision.

  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No further contact with Brian Bohn.
Defendant to provide DNA sample, if not yet provided, immediately if in custody otherwise within (3) business days at the Waukesha County Sheriff Department.

Brian J. Juech appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Stacey M Hutterer in court, in custody (Waukesha County Jail), with attorney Katie B. Bricco.   
Case called along with:  14CF936 & 14CF1160

Defendant enters a plea of Guilty to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.

State requests a PSI prior to sentencing.
Defense has no objections.

Court orders a PSI be conducted.
PSI to be filed by: 04/17/15.
Next court date will be for sentencing.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for April 29, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Request for an earlier cout date for plea and sentencing than February 18, 2915, filed by Attorney Bricco.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

  Hearing scheduled for February 18, 2015 at 02:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on January 22, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant is not to use/possess any controlled substances without a valid prescription and take as prescribed.  Defendant to report/comply with Wisconsin Community Services Pretrial Supervision Program.   Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing. Defendant to go to WCS within 1 business day.
